result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean D. Gabrielson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment.

Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant must use only 1 pharmacy for all prescription needs.
Defendant shall inform Agent within 72 hours of doctor appointments and new or changing prescriptions.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean D. Gabrielson

Restitution hearing covering the following cases: 13CF285, 13CF286, 14CF67, and 14CF68. 
Defendant Sean D. Gabrielson in court (in custody) with attorney Thomas W. Johnson. 
Defendant Karyn M. Gabrielson in court (in custody) with attorney Edmund Jelinski. 
James H. Fassbender appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Statements by ADA Fassbender regarding Pawn America's restitution request. 
Statements by the Court. 
Greg Schulke sworn and testified. 
Ex. 1 - evaluation of items taken, offered by ADA Fassbender, marked. 
Ex. 2 - Pawn America ticket, offered by Atty Jelinski, marked.
Witness excused. 
Statements by Atty Jelinski regarding items in the possession of the Sheriff's Department. 
Arguments by counsel. 
Court orders restitiution joint and several as follows:
$540.00 to Pawn America, 
$718.45 to Greg Schulke,
an additional $77.84 to Greg Schulke, if battery charger and jigsaw are not in the possession of the Sheriff's Department.
Statements by attorneys Johnson and Jelinski regarding imposed/stayed jail time.
The Court will direct the Agent to send letter of recommendation.
Once letter is received, it will be forwarded to counsel. 
The Court directs counsel to request an additional hearing if they feel it's needed.
JOC
